title: [BEAM-12491] Fix reporting of throttling metric
body:
#14723 introduced a bug where a counter would be increased with a float value, not an integer, causing builds to fail (https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Python37/3899/). I ran all my integration tests on Dataflow and couldn't reproduce the issue, so it's possible this is specific to the direct runner. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-8376] Google Cloud Firestore Connector - Add Firestore v1 Read Operations
body:
Entry point for accessing Firestore V1 read methods is `FirestoreIO.v1().read()`. Currently supported read RPC methods: * `PartitionQuery` * `RunQuery` * `ListCollectionIds` * `ListDocuments` * `BatchGetDocuments` ### Unit Tests No external dependencies are needed for this suite A large suite of unit tests have been added to cover most branches and error scenarios in the various components. Test for input validation and bounds checking are also included in this suite. ### Integration Tests Integration tests for each type of RPC is present in `org.apache.beam.sdk.io.gcp.firestore.it.FirestoreV1IT`. All of these tests leverage `TestPipeline` and verify the expected Documents/Collections are all operated on during the test. ### Reviewers R: @chamikaramj R: @jlara310 (Firestore Technical Writer) R: @cynthiachi (Firestore Dataplane) R: @danthev (Firestore SRE) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-12641] Use google-auth instead of oauth2client for GCP auth
body:
This change switches the GCP auth library from `oauth2client` to `google-auth`. `google-auth-httplib2` library is used to provide authorized HTTP clients that work with the existing vendored libraries for BigQuery, GCS, etc. I'm interested in this migration because of the need to use custom token URIs for issuing service account tokens--it's supported by `google-auth` but not `oauth2client`. dev list discussion thread: https://lists.apache.org/x/thread.html/r4345315bfa80c6181138d556317a45d7692cd2b37d1d341238e5440a@%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9547] Fix sample weight calculation
body:
From https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/14984#issuecomment-859760159: > https://www.cti.gr/images_gr/reports/99-06-02.ps looks like it does the trick. Rather than weight * random(), one needs to take the largest N of random() ^ (1/weight). This is the same as the log(random()) / weight. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-9547] Add implementation for first and last
body:

title: [BEAM-4767] Remove release script lines to replace container version
body:
These constants are no longer used for release candidates/releases after https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/14814 - removing. I think set_version.sh was already not getting used because of https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/release/src/main/scripts/cut_release_branch.sh#L128. I'm not sure we should be replacing the beam-master-XXXXXXX values at all since they don't really matter. Added a demo test/PR to show that we no longer use these values for released versions https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/14989 ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Add a setting to enable dill byref pickling in Beam pickler.
body:
byref setting is False by default. This leads to increase in pipeline size (most of the time unnecessary, given that the code has to be shared between workers besides simplest cases) and unexpected class duplication during API roundtrips. Since enabling byref unconditionally may be risky, just adding the option for now. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12464] Change ProtoSchemaTranslator beam schema creation to match the order for protobufs containing Oneof fields
body:
Currently, when ProtoSchemaTranslator creates the beam schema from a protobuf definition it always puts the Oneofs at the start of the beam schema due to oneofs always being created first. This means that the order of the fields doesn't match the order of the protobuf definition. As the schema generation is used when converting from beam rows to protobufs, it additionally means that it is impossible to convert from a beam row where the oneof fields are not the first fields in the beamrow. This change orders the resultant beam schema to match the order in the protobuf definition. Additionally, this PR updates the test protos so that the beam schema in the oneof tests matches the protobuf definition, as opposed to the beam row having the Oneofs first. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-12464] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: Minor: Fix bug where interactive_beam API documentation is not visible
body:
I noticed that documentation for `ib.collect` and other methods isn't showing up in the [API docs](https://beam.apache.org/releases/pydoc/2.29.0/apache_beam.runners.interactive.interactive_beam.html). This PR adds [`@functools.wraps`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functools.html#functools.wraps) to address this. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12446] Throw exception when DoFn process has wrong arg order
body:
if kw args of process function are declared before DnFnParam placeholders the fulfillment will shift to wrong index unexpectedly. For example if process has signature ``` def process(element, an_arg='x', w=DoFn.WindowParam): ... ``` at runtime the window param will be mapped onto 'an_arg' instead of w, and w will not be replaced with runtime value, causing confusing behaviors. (e.g. an_arg will be an instance of GlobalWindow or FixedWindow but w is still DoFn.WindowParam). This PR prevents unexpected ArgPlaceholder fulfillment shift. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-9547] Add support for tz_convert, workaround DatetimeIndex hashing bug
body:
This PR adds a simple implementation for `tz_convert` and tests. Unfortunately testing it exposed https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/41817, where `pd.util.hash_array` (used for partitioning) fails on `DatetimeIndex` instances with a tz specified. Note this is a bug in Beam code, `hash_array` is only intended to operate on numpy arrays or pandas ExtensionArrays. This PR fixes the issue in Beam - we now convert index values to a numpy array with `np.asarray` before passing to `hash_array`. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: [BEAM-12453]: Add interface to access I/O topic information for a Samza Beam job and PipelineJsonRenderer to create the JSON Beam DAG
body:
New Features: 1. This PR creates an interface inside Samza Beam Runner to get I/O information for a Samza Beam job. 2. It also adds a PipelineJsonRenderer which renders the Beam DAG in JSON form. Uses: 1. The SamzaIOInfo interface can be implemented to emit I/O information of a Samza job. This is used by the PipelineJsonRenderer to add I/O information to the Beam DAG. 2. The JSON renderer helps emit the Beam DAG in JSON form as a config. These changes can be used in the visualization of the Beam pipeline. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-12421] Migrates ElasticsearchIOTest to use testContainers
body:
Tackles the migration of ElasticsearchIOTest from in mem Elasticsearch emulator to using test containers instead. **This PR also drops testing support for Elasticsearch 2.x** which was previously agreed to by the mailing list[1]. This change set aims to address some of the flakiness with ES testing. I'd especially like to give credit to @ludovic-boutros whose work this PR is heavily based on. title: [BEAM-9547] Add support for `DataFrame.value_counts()`
body:
Note that this implementation makes the default value `sort=False`, since we cannot guarantee the order that's imposed will be preserved. The PR also includes a new (non-pandas) method called `length()`. This is intended as an altenative for `__len__()` that produces a `DeferredScalar`. It's helpful because the result can be used in arithmetic with `DeferredFrame` instances, which is done in the `value_counts(normalize=True)` implementation. `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------
